data.title: Bangkok Life Assurance’s New Vision: “The Most Caring Insurance Brand”
data.description: Bangkok Life Assurance Public Limited Company has unveiled a renewed vision grounded in “Caring,” launching a brand campaign to become “The Most Caring Insurance Brand” and drive sustainable growth. Mr. Chone Sophonpanich, President and CEO, emphasised that “Caring” has long been a cornerstone of the company’s mission, shaping its life and health insurance products, the BLA Every Care programme, and interactions with clients, agents, and financial advisors. Customer insights reveal that “Caring” is the top attribute associated with the Bangkok Life brand.

data.title: Maris allays concerns on Overlapping Claims Area in Gulf
data.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Maris Sangiampongsa sought to allay concerns over upcoming talks with Cambodia regarding issues related to the Overlapping Claims Area (OCA) in the Gulf of Thailand, stressing that for the negotiations to be successful, they must be mutually accepted by both nations.

data.title: From space missions to smart factories
data.description: Personal computers, GPS, mobile phones, digital cameras, the internet: many of the technologies in our lives today are older than we might think. They originate from concepts from the 1960s and 70s - an enormously creative, innovative period.

data.title: Unocha: Over one-third of Myanmar's population urgently needs humanitarian aid
data.description: According to a statement from Unocha, more than a third of the country’s population urgently requires humanitarian aid, especially food, shelter, clean water, and healthcare, due to ongoing armed conflicts.

data.title: Over one-third of Myanmar's population urgently needs humanitarian aid amid conflict and displacement, says UNOCHA
data.description: According to a statement from UNOCHA, more than a third of the country’s population urgently requires humanitarian aid, especially food, shelter, clean water, and healthcare, due to ongoing armed conflicts.

data.title: Lhasa residents unite to paint Potala Palace in annual tradition
data.description: Over the last week, thousands of residents of Lhasa have joined the work of painting the exterior walls of the Potala Palace, an annual routine "makeover" project for the UNESCO World Heritage site.

data.title: 'Million Gifts, Million Smiles' returns to help kids in the South
data.description: For more than two decades, the turmoil in the southern border provinces has persisted, significantly impacting the mental well-being of numerous children and young people.

data.title: CentralWorld hosts YWCA Diplomatic Charity Bazaar
data.description: CentralWorld has been transformed into an international Christmas market featuring premium gifts from around the world for the 69th YWCA Diplomatic Charity Bazaar, which kicks off today and runs until Sunday.

data.title: Swing dance transforms art at Asai Bangkok
data.description: The vibrancy of swing dance is transformed into visual art during "Mood Swing", which will kick off on Saturday and run until Jan 18, at Asai Bangkok Chinatown on Charoen Krung Road.

data.title: Exhibition explores coastal changes
data.description: The impact of capitalist intervention on a local fishing community in the Deep South is reflected through mixed media artworks during "From Nomad To Nowhere", running at Warin Lab Contemporary, until Nov 30.

data.title: PM signs off on Isoc integrity project banning 'gifts'
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra has kicked off the "No Gift Policy" for the Internal Security Operations Command (Isoc), ensuring its officers do not receive gifts in return for their services.

data.title: New panel to reduce school dropout rates
data.description: The Ministry of Education will set up a committee to lead efforts to curb high school dropout rates.

data.description: Phuket: Local authorities in Patong municipality are working to overhaul the city

data.title: Dugongs 'may decline 70%'
data.description: Dugong populations in the Andaman Sea are expected to decline by 70% over the next four years due to the diminishing supply of seagrass, which is their main source of food, a marine biologist has warned.

data.title: Trump victory caps amazing comeback
data.description: PALM BEACH - Donald Trump has been elected US president, capping a remarkable comeback four years after he was voted out of the White House and ushering in a new American leadership likely to test democratic institutions at home and relations abroad.

data.title: Russell Crowe back in Bangkok
data.description: Hollywood actor  Russell Crowe , who has endeared himself to Thais in recent years with his enthusiastic online posts about the country, is back in Bangkok.

data.title: What will Elon Musk get for his $130 million?
data.description: No billionaire did more to help Donald Trump win the US presidential election than Elon Musk. The Tesla and SpaceX boss will now find out whether it pays off or he ends up getting burned.
